functions.name: _acknowledgeEvent
functions.description: Acknowledge an event at the backend

parameters.name: eventId
parameters.description: ID of the event to acknowledge

functions.name: _fetchPendingFromBackend
functions.description: Fetch pending events from backend

functions.name: acknowledgeEvent
functions.description:
Manually acknowledge an event.
Use this when handling events via onQueueEvent.

parameters.name: eventId
parameters.description: ID of the event to acknowledge

functions.name: addEvent
functions.description: Add an event to a target agent's queue

returns.description: Promise resolving to the created event

functions.name: checkForPendingExternalEvent
functions.description:
Check for any pending external events without waiting.
Returns the first pending event or null if none available.

returns.description: The first pending event or null

functions.name: clearLocalCache
functions.description: Clear the local event cache (does not affect backend)

functions.name: clearQueue
functions.description: Clear the queue for an agent

parameters.name: agentId
parameters.description: Optional agent ID (defaults to current agent)

returns.description: Promise resolving to success confirmation

functions.name: getLocalCacheSize
functions.description: Get the number of events in the local cache

returns.description: Number of cached events

functions.name: getPendingExternalEventCount
functions.description: Get the count of pending external events.

returns.description: Number of pending events

functions.name: getPendingExternalEvents
functions.description:
Get all pending external events.
Returns all pending events and clears the cache.

returns.description: Array of pending events

functions.name: getPendingQueueEvents
functions.description:
Get pending events from local cache.
Sends acknowledgement for each event and removes from local cache.
If no local events, fetches from backend.

parameters.name: maxDepth
parameters.description: Maximum number of events to return (default: all)

returns.description: Promise resolving to array of events

functions.name: getQueueStats
functions.description: Get queue statistics

returns.description: Promise resolving to queue statistics

functions.name: onQueueEvent
functions.description:
Register an event handler that will be called when events are received.
The handler receives events as they arrive via WebSocket.
Note: This does NOT automatically acknowledge events.

parameters.name: handler
parameters.description: Function to call when an event is received

returns.description: Unsubscribe function

functions.name: peekLocalCache
functions.description: Get all events currently in the local cache without removing them

returns.description: Array of cached events

functions.name: sendAgentMessage
functions.description: Send an inter-agent message (convenience wrapper)

returns.description: Promise resolving to the created event

functions.name: waitForAnyExternalEvent
functions.description:
Waits for any external event from multiple sources:
- Agent queue events (from local cache or WebSocket)
- Background agent completions
- Grouped agent completions

Returns the first event that occurs from any source.

returns.description: A promise that resolves with the event type and data

functions.name: waitForNextQueueEvent
functions.description:
Wait for the next event(s) from the queue.
First checks local cache, then waits for WebSocket events.
Sends acknowledgement and removes from cache before resolving.

parameters.name: maxDepth
parameters.description: Maximum number of events to return (default: 1)

returns.description: Promise resolving to event(s)

functions.description:
Stops the ongoing process.

Stops the ongoing process.

returns.description: A promise that resolves with the response from the push event.

returns.description: A promise that resolves with the response from the status event.

functions.name: getModelConfig
functions.description:
Gets the model configuration for a specific model or the default application model.
If modelId is provided, returns configuration for that specific model.
If modelId is not provided, returns the default application LLM configuration.

parameters.name: modelId
parameters.description: Optional model identifier. If not provided, returns default model config.

returns.description: A promise that resolves with the model configuration including provider and model details.

functions.name: inference
functions.description:
Sends an inference request to the LLM using OpenAI message format with tools support.
The model is selected based on the provided `llmrole`. If the specific model
for the role is not found, it falls back to the default model for the current agent,
and ultimately to the default application-wide LLM if necessary.

parameters.name: params
parameters.description:
The inference parameters including:
  - messages: Array of conversation messages
  - tools: Available tools for the model to use
  - tool_choice: How the model should use tools
  - full: Whether to return full response
  - max_tokens: Maximum number of tokens to generate
  - temperature: Temperature for response generation
  - stream: Whether to stream the response

returns.description: A promise that resolves with the LLM's response

functions.description: Gets the summary (description) of a task.

returns.description: The task description

functions.name: updateTask
functions.description: Updates an existing task.

functions.name: executeCommand
functions.description:
Executes a given command and returns the result.
Listens for messages from the WebSocket that indicate the output, error, or finish state
of the executed command and resolves the promise accordingly.

returns.description: A promise that resolves with the command's output, error, or finish signal.

functions.name: executeCommandRunUntilError
functions.description:
Executes a given command and keeps running until an error occurs.
Listens for messages from the WebSocket and resolves the promise when an error is encountered.

returns.description: A promise that resolves when an error occurs during command execution.

functions.name: executeCommandRunUntilInterrupt
functions.description:
Executes a given command and keeps running until manually interrupted.
Listens for messages from the WebSocket and resolves the promise when interrupted.

parameters.name: executeInMain
parameters.description: Whether to execute in main terminal.

returns.description: A promise that resolves when the command is interrupted.

functions.name: executeCommandWithStream
functions.description:
Executes a given command and streams the output.
Listens for messages from the WebSocket and streams the output data.

returns.description: A promise that streams the output data during command execution.

functions.name: sendManualInterrupt
functions.description: Sends a manual interrupt signal to the terminal.

functions.name: createAndStartThread
functions.description: Creates and immediately starts a new thread.

parameters.name: options
parameters.description: The thread creation and start parameters

returns.description: A promise that resolves with the thread start response

functions.name: createThread
functions.description: Creates a new thread with comprehensive options.

returns.description: A promise that resolves with the thread creation response

functions.name: createThreadInBackground
functions.description: Creates a thread in the background and resolves when the agent starts or fails.

parameters.name: options
parameters.description: The thread creation and start parameters

returns.description: A promise that resolves with ThreadAgentStarted or ThreadAgentStartFailed response

functions.name: deleteThread
functions.description: Deletes a thread.

returns.description: A promise that resolves with the thread deletion response

functions.name: getThreadDetail
functions.description: Retrieves detailed information about a specific thread.

returns.description: A promise that resolves with the thread detail response

functions.name: getThreadFileChanges
functions.description: Retrieves file changes associated with a specific thread.

returns.description: A promise that resolves with the file changes

functions.name: getThreadFileChangesSummary
functions.description:
Retrieves file changes summary for ChangesSummaryPanel.
Returns data in the format: { title, changes, files }

returns.description: A promise that resolves with the file changes summary

functions.name: getThreadList
functions.description: Retrieves a list of threads with optional filtering.

returns.description: A promise that resolves with the thread list response

functions.name: getThreadMessages
functions.description: Retrieves messages for a specific thread.

returns.description: A promise that resolves with the thread messages response

functions.name: startThread
functions.description: Starts a thread.

returns.description: A promise that resolves with the thread start response

functions.name: updateThread
functions.description: Updates an existing thread.

returns.description: A promise that resolves with the thread update response

functions.name: updateThreadStatus
functions.description: Updates the status of a thread.

returns.description: A promise that resolves with the thread status update response

functions.description: Adds a token to the system via WebSocket.

modules.name: userMessage
modules.description: User message utilities for accessing current user message and context

functions.description: Get the current user message object

returns.description: Current UserMessage or undefined

functions.name: getCurrentFile

returns.description: Current file path or undefined

returns.description: Array of agent objects

functions.description: Get mentioned files from current message

returns.description: Array of file paths

functions.name: editFileAndApplyDiff
functions.description: Edits a file and applies a diff with AI assistance.

parameters.name: filePath
parameters.description: The path to the file to edit.

parameters.name: prompt
parameters.description: The prompt for the AI model.

parameters.name: applyModel
parameters.description: Optional model to use for applying the diff.

functions.name: addVectorItem
functions.description: Adds a new vector item to the vector database.

parameters.name: item
parameters.description: The item to add to the vector.

returns.description: A promise that resolves when the item is successfully added.

functions.name: getVector
functions.description: Retrieves a vector from the vector database based on the provided key.

parameters.name: key
parameters.description: The key of the vector to retrieve.

returns.description: A promise that resolves with the retrieved vector.

functions.name: queryVectorItem
functions.description: Queries a vector item from the vector database based on the provided key.

parameters.name: key
parameters.description: The key of the vector to query the item from.

returns.description: A promise that resolves with the queried vector item.

functions.name: queryVectorItems
functions.description: Queries a vector item from the vector database based on the provided key.

returns.description: A promise that resolves with the queried vector item.
